raw_affiliation_strings: Marvin O. Miller is the manager of the Underway Replenishment Department at the Naval Ship Weapon Systems Engineering Station (NSWSES), Port Hueneme, Calif. He is a graduate of the University of Michigan. He was a naval architect at the Hunters Point Naval Shipyard for 14 years where in 1956 he headed the first engineering group in the Navy to be dedicated to underway replenishment. He has been with NSWSES since 1964. He received the Secretary of the Navy's Distinguished Civilian Service A ward in 1975 for his contribution to underway replenishment. This year he received the Navy League of the United States Richard M. Thompson Award for Outstanding Civilian Leadership.

affiliations.raw_affiliation_string: Marvin O. Miller is the manager of the Underway Replenishment Department at the Naval Ship Weapon Systems Engineering Station (NSWSES), Port Hueneme, Calif. He is a graduate of the University of Michigan. He was a naval architect at the Hunters Point Naval Shipyard for 14 years where in 1956 he headed the first engineering group in the Navy to be dedicated to underway replenishment. He has been with NSWSES since 1964. He received the Secretary of the Navy's Distinguished Civilian Service A ward in 1975 for his contribution to underway replenishment. This year he received the Navy League of the United States Richard M. Thompson Award for Outstanding Civilian Leadership.

raw_affiliation_strings: John W. Hammed is the deputy manager of the Underway Replenishment Department at NSWSES. He is a graduate of North Dakota State University. He started his career as an engineer at Hunters Point Naval Shipyard where his first five years were in the design of aircraft carrier ammunition stowage and handling systems and the next four years were in the design of underway replenishment systems. Transferring to NSWSES in 1964 he was the naval engineer responsible for developing the STREAM UNREP operational procedures that are now standard throughout the fleet. He is currently directing the engineering development for using merchant ships to augment U.S. Navy UNREP ships.
